src:
En Bilbao junto a Manuela Carmena
Errejón: Si de Sánchez e Iglesias depende, "nos vamos a terceras elecciones"
05 Nov 2019, 19:41 by La Información

El candidato de Más País ha descrito el debate a cinco, al que no fue invitado, como un "espectáculo lamentable y bochornoso".

El candidato a la presidencia del Gobierno de Más País, Íñigo Errejón ha cargado contra los principales líderes de la izquierda y ha asegurado que, a raíz de lo sucedido en el debate a cinco, si de Pedro Sánchez y Pablo Iglesias depende, "nos vamos a terceras elecciones". El candidato ha descrito el 'enfrentamiento' televisivo de este lunes, al que el fundador de Podemos no estaba invitado, como un "espectáculo lamentable".
Errejón ha comentado esta cita política en un acto político que ha tenido lugar este martes en Bilbao, con simpatizantes y votantes de su formación en la capital vizcaína junto a la exalcaldesa de Madrid, Manuela Carmena, y el cabeza de su lista por Bizkaia, Txema Urquijo. En su intervenión, el ex número dos de Iglesias ha aseverado que se trató de una reunión de "políticos pequeñitos interesados únicamente en los intereses de sus siglas y de sí mismos".



Errejón ha criticado a Sánchez e Iglesias porque "tuvieron en su mano que hubiera un gobierno progresistas" que relegase a la ultraderecha de Santiago Abascal a la oposición, pero "consideraron, uno que merecía más la pena sacar un ministerio más y el otro, cinco diputados más".
Errejón ha agregado que este lunes, los espectadores observaron que "si vuelve a depender de ellos dos, nos vamos a terceras elecciones", algo que ha calificado como un "regalo" para la extrema derecha: "Hasta que por aburrimiento o cansancio o por incomparecencia de los progresistas, acaben ganando".
text:
In Bilbao with Manuela Carmena
Errejón: If Sánchez and Iglesias depends, "we are going to third elections"
05 Nov 2019, 19:41 by The Information

The candidate of More Country has described the debate to five, to which he was not invited, as a "shameful and embarrassing spectacle".

The candidate for the presidency of the Government of More Country, Íñigo Errejón has charged against the main leaders of the left and has ensured that, following what happened in the debate to five, if Pedro Sánchez and Pablo Iglesias depends, "we are leaving to third elections. " The candidate has described the television showdown on Monday, to which the founder of Podemos was not invited, as an "unfortunate spectacle."
Errejón has commented on this political event in a political event that took place on Tuesday in Bilbao, with supporters and voters of his training in the Biscay capital next to the former mayor of Madrid, Manuela Carmena, and the head of his list for Bizkaia, Txema Urquijo In his speech, the former number two of Iglesias has asserted that it was a meeting of "little politicians interested only in the interests of their acronyms and themselves."



Errejón has criticized Sánchez and Iglesias because "they had in their hands that there was a progressive government" that would relegate the opposition to the extreme right of Santiago Abascal, but "they considered, one that was more worthwhile to get one more ministry and the other, five more deputies. "
Errejón has added that this Monday, the spectators observed that "if it depends on them again, we are going to third elections", something that has qualified as a "gift" for the extreme right: "Until by boredom or fatigue or by lack of progressives, they end up winning. "
